Seasons greetings all. Yes, it has been a bit quiet. Jim is still 
counting chickens, no Hawks ( Sorry Jim :-) and I think will be back on 
track in the new year. I am now officially an assistant moderator here 
so if anyone need any help with memberships or spammer or whatever, I am 
happy to help out, though don't expect me to answer questions aimed at 
Jim LOL.

Great tsuba Curran, nice work and in good condition overall I think. I 
am about to head out for the afternoon so I will have a better look when 
I get a chance in the next few days.

It made me look into my folder to see what was there and it was old so I 
updated it. If anyone is interested.

*http://tinyurl.com/eyntq

*Merry Xmas all

Rich*
*
Curran Campbell wrote:

>List & sleeping Peter K.,
>
>Yes it has been dead quiet. I haven't had much to ask,
>nor much that I could help with. I have not heard from
>Jim G in a while. Is he okay? Just super busy?
>
>~~I do have a Higo tsuba question! I recently became
>the caretaker of a decent Higo tsuba. Currently it
>would be the only Higo tsuba I own and, alas, I have
>no Higo Kinko Taikan! It has been the one of the few
>book I've resisted (price) or missed getting for quite
>some time. 
>
>Photos are in the CURRAN folder of the group.
>Link:    http://tinyurl.com/9uucc
>
>Size is largish:   8.3cm x 7.65cm x .4 cm at its
>thickest.
>Gold and Silver, with extensive silver inlay.
>Iron condition- very nice. Dense.
>   It is like the nice Nakane Andy has listed at:
>http://www.nihonto.us/nakane%20tsuba.htm
>but the silver chain block work is more involved, and
>the mimi is raised around the plate, rather than being
>part of the plate as in the Nakane. Goldwork and Mon
>in both Gold and Silver. Iron seems a slight bit
>different too.
>
>(1)  How this one would be attributed within Higo?
>(2)  Approx Age?
>(3)  Fair Value?  <*least important, but I don't have
>a clue on this one, other than Andy's Nakane as a
>ref.>.
>
>Thanks in advance to all replys. Hope everyone has a
>good holiday.
>
>Curran
>
>  
>
